courseIdentity.title: Software Requirements Engineering
courseIdentity.catalogDescription: This course explores the critical process of gathering, analyzing, and documenting software requirements. Students learn to elicit stakeholder needs, create specifications, and manage requirements throughout the software development lifecycle.

courseLearningOutcomes.description: Elicit and document software requirements from diverse stakeholders
Create comprehensive requirement specifications using industry-standard formats
Manage requirements changes and traceability throughout project lifecycle
Validate and verify requirements for completeness and consistency

programLearningOutcomes.description: Design and implement software solutions using appropriate methodologies
Apply critical thinking to solve complex technical problems
Communicate technical concepts effectively to diverse audiences

topicalOutline.body:
Week 1-2: Introduction to Requirements Engineering
Week 3-4: Stakeholder Analysis and Elicitation Techniques
Week 5-6: Requirements Documentation and Specification
Week 7-8: Requirements Modeling and Analysis
Week 9-10: Requirements Validation and Verification
Week 11-12: Requirements Management and Traceability
Week 13-14: Agile Requirements and User Stories
Week 15: Final Project Presentations

majorAssessments.name: Stakeholder Interview Project
majorAssessments.description: Conduct interviews with real stakeholders to elicit requirements for a software system

majorAssessments.name: Requirements Specification Document
majorAssessments.description: Create a comprehensive SRS document for a proposed software system

majorAssessments.name: Requirements Management System
majorAssessments.description: Implement and demonstrate a requirements traceability matrix and change management process

facilities.body: Computer lab with 25 workstations, projector, and whiteboard

technology.body: Requirements management tools (JIRA, ReqIF), diagramming software (Lucidchart, Draw.io), collaborative documentation platforms

otherResources.body: Access to industry professionals for guest lectures and stakeholder interview practice
